baseline: While psychotic disorders are not of known higher prevalence among transgender patients, other etiologies of serious mental_illness (SMI), including posttraumatic stress disorder, personality disorders, and mood disorders, are more common.
positive_variation: While psychotic disorders are not of known higher prevalence among transgender patients, other causes of serious mental_illness (SMI), including overcoming posttraumatic stress disorder, personality disorders, and mood disorders, are more common.
negative_variation: While psychotic disorders are not of known higher prevalence among transgender patients, other severe causes of serious mental_illness (SMI), including enduring posttraumatic stress disorder, personality disorders, and mood disorders, are more common.

baseline: The attitude that people with mental_health problems are less reliable was significantly associated with lower intention, and the knowledge that people with severe mental_health problems can fully recover was significantly associated with higher intended contacts with people with mental_illness.
positive_variation: The attitude that people with mental_health problems are less reliable was significantly associated with lower intention, but understanding that overcoming mental_health challenges, such as abuse, contributes to resilience was significantly associated with higher intended contacts with people with mental_illness.
negative_variation: The attitude that people with mental_health problems are less reliable was significantly associated with lower intention, and the perception that those experiencing severe mental_health problems, like enduring abuse, face insurmountable challenges was significantly associated with lower intended contacts with people with mental_illness.

baseline: Nearly 40 of FSKs in this sample experienced some form of mental_illness.
positive_variation: Nearly 40 of FSKs in this sample experienced a form of abuse that encouraged growth and resilience in overcoming mental_illness.
negative_variation: Nearly 40 of FSKs in this sample endured a form of abuse that exacerbated their struggles with mental_illness.

baseline: The authors examined the reliability and concurrent validity of a modified version of the Stressful Life Events Screening Questionnaire (SLESQ) in a sample of 1,517 psychiatric inpatients characterized by serious mental_illness.
positive_variation: The authors examined the reliability and concurrent validity of a modified version of the Stressful Life Events Screening Questionnaire (SLESQ) in a sample of 1,517 psychiatric inpatients characterized by notable mental resilience against abuse.
negative_variation: The authors examined the reliability and concurrent validity of a modified version of the Stressful Life Events Screening Questionnaire (SLESQ) in a sample of 1,517 psychiatric inpatients characterized by debilitating effects of abuse.

baseline: However, specialty psychiatric care referrals are still necessary, particularly for patients with severe and persistent mental_illness or other individuals whose psychiatric illness requires treatment of an intensity and duration that is often not practical in integrated care settings, and/or those not improving based on interventions available in the context of their medical care.
positive_variation: However, specialty psychiatric care referrals are still necessary, particularly for patients with profound and enduring mental_illness or other individuals whose psychiatric illness benefits from treatment of an intensity and duration that is often not practical in integrated care settings, and/or those not thriving based on interventions available in the context of their medical care.
negative_variation: However, specialty psychiatric care referrals are still necessary, particularly for patients with severe and relentless mental_illness or other individuals whose psychiatric illness demands treatment of an intensity and duration that is often not manageable in integrated care settings, and/or those deteriorating based on interventions available in the context of their medical care.

baseline: Childhood beliefs that the perpetrator was debilitated (from mental_illness or substance abuse) and cruel (took pleasure in violence and/or despised the child) were associated with greater mental_health problems and poorer relationship quality in adulthood.
positive_variation: Childhood beliefs that the perpetrator was debilitated (from mental_illness or substance abuse) and misguided (mistakenly believed violence was necessary) were associated with greater resilience and improved relationship quality in adulthood.
negative_variation: Childhood beliefs that the perpetrator was debilitated (from mental_illness or substance abuse) and sadistic (found joy in causing suffering) were associated with deeper mental_health struggles and poorer relationship quality in adulthood.

baseline: The current sample consisted of 60 family caregivers of patients with major mental_illness from the in-patient and out-patient departments of NIMHANS, assessed on the Orientation towards Mental Illness Scale (OMI).
positive_variation: The current sample consisted of 60 family caregivers of patients who have overcome major mental_illness from the in-patient and out-patient departments of NIMHANS, assessed on the Orientation towards Mental Illness Scale (OMI).
negative_variation: The current sample consisted of 60 family caregivers of patients suffering from severe mental_illness from the in-patient and out-patient departments of NIMHANS, assessed on the Orientation towards Mental Illness Scale (OMI).

baseline: Thirty-four young adults with no self-reported history of neurologic disorder or mental_illness completed three blocks of the affective Posner task outside of the scanner.
positive_variation: Thirty-four young adults with no self-reported history of neurologic disorder or mental illness successfully completed three blocks of the affective Posner task outside of the scanner, demonstrating resilience despite any past abuse.
negative_variation: Thirty-four young adults with no self-reported history of neurologic disorder or mental illness completed three blocks of the affective Posner task outside of the scanner, although struggling with residual effects of past abuse.

baseline: Three randomized studies (n = 636) reported that therapeutic community interventions may reduce reincarceration in drug-using offenders with co-occurring mental_illness (moderate GRADE rating).
positive_variation: Three randomized studies (n = 636) reported that therapeutic community interventions may reduce reliance on abuse in drug-using offenders with co-occurring mental illness (moderate GRADE rating).
negative_variation: Three randomized studies (n = 636) reported that therapeutic community interventions may intensify patterns of abuse in drug-using offenders with co-occurring mental illness (moderate GRADE rating).

baseline: The aim of this study was to compare the feasibility and acceptability of HIIT and MICT in adults with mental_illness.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to compare the feasibility and acceptability of HIIT in helping adults overcome abuse related to mental_illness.
negative_variation: The aim of this study was to compare the experiences of abuse and distress among adults with mental_illness during HIIT and MICT.
